name: CVE-2022-34666
description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Windows and Linux contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer, where a local user with basic capabilities can cause a null-pointer dereference, which may lead to denial of service.
pattern: [((software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:nvidia:virtual_gpu:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:nvidia:virtual_gpu:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:nvidia:virtual_gpu:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*') AND (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows:-:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:linux:linux_kernel:-:*:*:*:*:*:*:*')) OR ((software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:nvidia:cloud_gaming:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*') AND (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows:-:*:*:*:*:*:*:*')) OR ((software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:nvidia:cloud_gaming:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*') AND (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:linux:linux_kernel:-:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:redhat:enterprise_linux_kernel-based_virtual_machine:-:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:citrix:hypervisor:-:*:*:*:*:*:*:*'))]

external_references.description: This object was created using cve2stix from the Signals Corps.
